# SCNView

**Class**

A view for displaying 3D SceneKit content.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class SCNView
```

## Overview

In macOS, [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] is a subclass of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSView]. In iOS and tvOS, [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] is a subclass of [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIView]. As part of either operating system’s view hierarchy, an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] object provides a place for SceneKit content in your app’s user interface. You can create a SceneKit view by using its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView/init(frame:options:)] method or by adding it to a nib file or storyboard.  To provide content for a SceneKit view, assign an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNScene] object to its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView/scene] property.

For additional important methods and properties for working with SceneKit views, see the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer] protocol. (You can also render SceneKit content into an arbitrary Metal command queue or OpenGL context using the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNRenderer] class, or into a Core Animation layer on macOS using the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLayer] class. The [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer] protocol defines functionality common to all three SceneKit rendering classes.)

## Initializing a SceneKit View

- **init(frame:options:)**: Initializes and returns a newly allocated SceneKit view object with the specified frame rectangle and options.
- **SCNView.Option**: Dictionary keys specifying initialization options, used when initializing a SceneKit view.

## Specifying a Scene

- **scene**: The scene to be displayed in the view.

## Configuring a View

- **backgroundColor**: The background color of the view.
- **preferredFramesPerSecond**: The animation frame rate that the view uses to render its scene.
- **rendersContinuously**: A Boolean value that determines whether the view always renders at its preferred frame rate or only when its visible content changes.
- **antialiasingMode**: The antialiasing mode used for rendering the view’s scene.
- **SCNAntialiasingMode**: Modes for antialiased rendering of the view’s scene, used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] property.

## Managing Camera Controls

- **allowsCameraControl**: A Boolean value that determines whether the user can manipulate the current point of view that is used to render the scene.
- **cameraControlConfiguration**: The current configuration for the camera controller’s event-handling behavior.
- **SCNCameraControlConfiguration**: Properties affecting the behavior of a camera controller.
- **defaultCameraController**
- **SCNCameraController**

## Playing Action and Animation in a View’s Scene

- **pause(_:)**: Pauses playback of the view’s scene.
- **play(_:)**: Resumes playback of the view’s scene.
- **stop(_:)**: Stops playback of the view’s scene and resets the scene time to its start time.

## Capturing a View Snapshot

- **snapshot()**: Renders the view’s scene into a new image object.

## Working with a View’s OpenGL ES Context

- **eaglContext**: The OpenGL ES context that the view uses to render its contents.

## Working with a View’s OpenGL Context

- **openGLContext**: The OpenGL context that the view uses to render its contents.
- **pixelFormat**: The view’s OpenGL pixel format.

## Instance Properties

- **drawableResizesAsynchronously**

## Essentials

- **SCNScene**: A container for the node hierarchy and global properties that together form a displayable 3D scene.
- **SceneView**: A SwiftUI view for displaying 3D SceneKit content.
